meanings.definition: To consign or dismiss to an inferior rank or position.
meanings.sent1: The old toys were relegated to the bottom shelf.
meanings.sent2: The team was relegated to the second division after losing the match.
meanings.sent3: The worn-out shoes were relegated to the back of the closet.
meanings.sent4: Her once prized possession was relegated to a dusty corner.
meanings.sent5: The forgotten book was relegated to the dark depths of the library.

meanings.definition: To assign to an inferior or less important position, place, or condition.
meanings.sent1: The substitute teacher was relegated to playground duty.
meanings.sent2: The intern was relegated to sorting paperwork in the office.
meanings.sent3: The broken chair was relegated to the corner with a 'Do Not Sit' sign.
meanings.sent4: His dreams of stardom were relegated to mere fantasies.
meanings.sent5: The rusty bike was relegated to the far end of the garage.

meanings.definition: To transfer to a less important position or rank.
meanings.sent1: The employee was relegated to a lower role in the company.
meanings.sent2: The student was relegated to the remedial class for extra help.
meanings.sent3: The faded painting was relegated to the attic for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: His once powerful status was relegated to mere bystander.
meanings.sent5: The wilted flowers were relegated to the compost pile.
